Overview
This procedure provides instructions on how to set OpenStack environment variables which are set with OpenStack RC file. This file can be version V2 or version V3. To set OpenStack environment variables:

note.p: pAutoSU connects with Openstack and queries for information using the client command openstack.

info.p: Download the OpenStack RC file as follows:

li.p: In the OpenStack Dashboard, select <PROJECT> from the Project drop-down list.
For CBIS 19.0 OpenStack: From the Projects menu, select the API Access menu, then select the Download OpenStack RC File drop-down list and click OpenStack RC File v2 or v3.
Save the OpenStack RC file as <PROJECT>-openrc.sh to $AUTO_HOME.

step.cmd: Retrieve the CA certificate for the cloud and save it with the “pem” extension (for example, CAPL038.pem) to the $AUTO_HOME directory.
Modify the $AUTO_HOME/<PROJECT>-openrc.sh file from step 1 above and include the following line:

info.p: export OS_CACERT="$AUTO_HOME/<CA certificate filename from step 2>".
